intro: Lamprodithyros gracilis, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lamprodithyros gracilis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
